channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: 'Complacent and lost control' - Man City's second-half problem
item.description: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains why Manchester City's collapse from a 2-0 half-time lead to draw 2-2 with Tottenham was not just a tactical issue.

item.title: Is Carrick proving Amorim's Man Utd tenure was a wasted year?
item.description: A third win in a row for Michael Carrick highlights the failures of Ruben Amorim's time at Manchester United.

item.title: 'If Arsenal don't win title now the blame will be entirely their own'
item.description: Arsenal will only have themselves to blame if they do not win the title as their rivals stumble in a perfect weekend for the Gunners, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'Not often you can write Arsenal history' - Gunners win Champions Cup
item.description: The inaugural Women's Champions Cup delivered the kind of spectacle Fifa would have hoped for when launching the new inter-continental competition last March.

item.title: Long delays, irate managers and mixed messages - is VAR bad for game?
item.description: More contentious VAR decisions in the Premier League have raised further questions on its effect on games as a spectacle.

item.title: Booed by some, loved by others - why does Vinicius divide Real fans?
item.description: Despite scoring a vital goal against Rayo Vallecano, why does forward Vinicius Jr continue to split opinion at the Bernabeu?

item.title: How does January window compare and what could happen on deadline day?
item.description: With transfer deadline day approaching, how does the January window compare to previous years and what could still happen?

item.title: Liverpool agree £60m deal for defender Jacquet
item.description: Liverpool agree a £60m deal with Rennes for defender Jeremy Jacquet, with the player set to join the Reds in the summer.

item.title: Does Rangers' title bid hinge on signing new striker?
item.description: Andy Halliday questions whether Rangers have the attacking output to win the league after Sunday's goalless draw at Hibernian - but what do the numbers say?

item.title: Juventus want Everton striker Beto - Monday's gossip
item.description: Marcus Rashford's future may be out of Manchester United's control, Liverpool look set to miss out on a target and Newcastle United's Jamaal Lascelles could be heading for the Championship.

item.title: Celtic close to two signings & eyeing more - O'Neill
item.description: Celtic interim manager Martin O'Neill reveals two prospective signings are having medicals and hinted the club could do further deals after his team beat Falkirk 2-0 to move above Rangers into second place in the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: Why Man City have toppled Chelsea as England's best
item.description: Manchester City's victory over Chelsea was confirmation they are the best team in the country this season and they are the WSL champions in waiting.

item.title: Solanke scorpion kick helps Spurs fight back against Man City
item.description: Dominic Solanke scores twice, including a spectacular scorpion kick, as Tottenham come from behind to draw against Manchester City with a rousing second-half performance.

item.title: Sesko scores dramatic late winner as Man Utd beat Fulham
item.description: Manchester United avoided Fulham's late comeback due to a Benjamin Sesko goal in stoppage time to give United three points and continue head coach Michael Carrick's perfect start.

item.title: 10-man Brentford hold on for hard-fought win at Villa
item.description: Brentford hold on to an important win against Aston Villa, despite Kevin Schade's sending off during the first half.

item.title: Sarr earns Palace draw at Forest as Williams sees red for handball
item.description: Neco Williams is sent off for deliberate handball in Nottingham Forest's draw with Crystal Palace, as he punched Jefferson Lerma's goalbound header off the line.

item.title: Who is in the relegation fight - and what is needed for survival?
item.description: Could West Ham, Burnley or Wolves defy the odds and secure Premier League survival?

item.title: Spurs can create magic together - Frank
item.description: Dissent was in the air among Tottenham fans at half-time against Manchester City. At full-time they were singing "Oh when the Spurs go marching in".

item.title: Wolves accept reduced £48m offer for Strand Larsen
item.description: Wolves have accepted a reduced offer worth £48m for striker Jorgen Strand Larsen from Crystal Palace.

item.title: Real and England wait on Bellingham injury
item.description: Real Madrid are waiting to discover if midfielder Jude Bellingham faces a spell out after he suffers a muscle injury during the win against Rayo Vallecano.

item.title: Arsenal midfielder Merino to have foot surgery
item.description: Arsenal hope to have midfielder Mikel Merino back before the end of the season after specialists say he will need a foot operation.

item.title: Saint-Maximin leaves club over racist abuse of his children
item.description: Former Newcastle United winger Allan Saint-Maximin leaves Mexican side Club America by mutual consent after saying his children were the victims of racist abuse.

item.title: 'Sweet Kerolin' steals show as Man City move closer to title
item.description: Brazil winger Kerolin steals the show with a "phenomenal" hat-trick as Manchester City thrash champions Chelsea to move closer to a first WSL title since 2016.

item.title: Liverpool switch for Sunderland loanee Geertruida unlikely
item.description: Liverpool's move to sign Lutsharel Geertruida on loan looks unlikely as the deal has too many moving parts to resolve before the transfer window closes.

item.title: Moves to look out for on transfer deadline day
item.description: Sami Mokbel, Danny Murphy, Troy Deeney and Mark Chapman discuss which transfers could impact Premier League clubs on Monday's transfer deadline day.

item.title: 'Pass forward, run forward' - Spurs' superb second half
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Troy Deeney analyse how Spurs mounted a superb second-half comeback in their 2-2 draw against Manchester City.

item.title: Will Man Utd miss Casemiro?
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Troy Deeney discuss whether Manchester United will miss the departing Casemiro's intelligence and calmness, after he inspired the Red Devils' to a 3-2 win over Fulham.

item.title: 'Sweet Kerolin' - Man City forward scores superb chip
item.description: Manchester City forward Kerolin scores from a lightning-fast counter attack, the second of an eventual hat trick for the Brazilian against Chelsea.

item.title: Late Mbappe penalty rescues Real Madrid against Vallecano
item.description: A stoppage-time penalty from Kylian Mbappe sees Real Madrid over the line against nine-man Rayo Vallecano, narrowing the gap behinf league leaders Barcelona to one point.

item.title: Watford boss Gracia resigns after three months
item.description: Javi Gracia resigns as Watford manager after just over three months in job.

item.title: What does Martindale's move upstairs mean for Livingston?
item.description: What does David Martindale's move to sporting director role mean for a Livingston side now managed by Marvin Bartley?

item.title: Everton closing in on deal for Chelsea winger George
item.description: Everton are finalising an initial loan deal to sign Chelsea's England Under-21 winger Tyrique George, with an option to buy included.

item.title: Forest sign Man City keeper Ortega
item.description: Nottingham Forest sign Stefan Ortega, who has not played for Manchester City this season, in a deal worth up to £500,000.

item.title: Atalanta's Lookman set to join Atletico Madrid
item.description: Ademola Lookman is set to join Atletico Madrid from Atalanta for 35m euros (£30.3m) with the 28-year-old forward due to travel to Spain to undergo a medical.

item.title: Chelsea and Strasbourg in talks to swap defenders
item.description: Chelsea are in talks to recall Mamadou Sarr from Strasbourg, with Aaron Anselmino expected to move in the opposite direction.

item.title: Wrexham sign defender Vyner from Bristol City
item.description: Defender Zak Vyner has sealed a move from Bristol City to Championship rivals Wrexham.

item.title: Man City still there despite 'setback' - Guardiola
item.description: Pep Guardiola insists Manchester City are still in the title race, despite a draw against Tottenham Hotspur leaving them six points behind leaders Arsenal.

item.title: How 10-man Brentford 'suffocated' Villa
item.description: Danny Murphy and Troy Deeney discuss how Keith Andrews set Brentford up defensively to "suffocate" Aston Villa, even when they went down to 10 men, and earn a 1-0 win at Villa Park.

item.title: Naalsund scores two against Liverpool as Man Utd go second
item.description: A brace from Lisa Naasland helped Manchester United beat Liverpool, moving them up to second in the WSL.

item.title: Either Mateta stays or we get a new striker - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner was coy on the future of Jean-Philippe Mateta, but maintains his side need a striker after failing to beat 10-man Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Kerolin hat-trick sees Man City crush Chelsea title hopes
item.description: A hat-trick from Kerolin saw Manchester City sweep Chelsea aside in an emphatic victory, giving them a dominant lead at the top of the WSL table.

item.title: 'Everything is a mess' - Man Utd fans protest before game
item.description: Man Utd fan group 'The 1958' lead a protest at Old Trafford against the club's owners Sir Jim Ratcliffe and the Glazer family before the match against Fulham.

item.title: 'Torres-like' Ekitike haunts long-term admirers Newcastle
item.description: Newcastle United needed no reminding of Hugo Ekitike's quality after trying to sign him last summer - and the Liverpool striker haunted his former suitors at Anfield on Saturday.

item.title: The most powerful woman in football - meet game's first female super agent
item.description: Super agent Rafaela Pimenta looks after some of the biggest names in the game - and has spoken exclusively to the BBC.

item.title: Nine siblings and a dog called Zoomer - Wirtz in his own words
item.description: Florian Wirtz sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his slow start at Anfield, playing padel and making Bundesliga history.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v boxer Francesca Hennessy
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on boxer Francesca Hennessy and AI with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Journalist dreams & Keane reunion? How O'Neill continues to revive Celtic
item.description: Showman Martin O'Neill continues to thrive as Celtic's interim manager as he guides the club through to the Europa League play-off round.

item.title: Transfers - February 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Why do Premier League teams spend less in January?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why clubs spend significantly more on new signings in the summer than they do in the January transfer window.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who do Arsenal play in final?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Watch the defeat to Motherwell that ended Martindale's Livi reign
item.description: Watch highlights as Motherwell win 2-0 in what proved to be David Martindale's final game as Livingston manager before he moves upstairs to become sporting director.

item.title: Barca president unhappy at teen's 'unpleasant' PSG move
item.description: PSG sign 18-year-old Barcelona midfielder Dro Fernandez, with the Spanish side's president calling the situation around the transfer "unpleasant".

item.title: Why La Liga title race is back on
item.description: A slip from Barcelona and a resurgent Real Madrid means the title race is back on in La Liga.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
